topic.title: Monitoring CPU temperature in real time
topic.para: To monitor the temperature in real time, run the watch command:

The watch command is a built-in Linux utility that runs user-defined commands at regular intervals. Its combination with sensors is useful if you need to keep an eye on your system's temperatures or voltages. The result looks as follows:
topic.screen:
Every 2.0s: sensors
iwlwifi_1-virtual-0 Adapter: Virtual device temp1: +56.0°C
k10temp-pci-00c3 Adapter: PCI adapter Tctl: +57.8°C
amdgpu-pci-0600 Adapter: PCI adapter vddgfx: +0.73 V vddnb: +0.74 V edge: +50.0°C PPT: 0.00 W
topic.para: By default, the watch command updates the output every two seconds. You can change this interval by using the -n option followed by the number of seconds. For example, to change the interval to 5 seconds, use:
Press C to stop the watch command.
